intro: Cyanea crispa, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the tropical climate with its succulent leaves and salt-tolerant properties. Cyanea crispa is also known for its fragrant blossoms and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it an important species in Hawaiian flora.
